summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/10/09 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Russell Lee Fine', 'Paul A. Edwards', 'Douglas Aarniokoski', 'Ken Olin', 'Marc Roskin', 'Dwight H. Little', 'Wendey Stanzler', 'Kate Dennis', 'Olatunde Osunsanmi', "Jim O'Hanlon"], 'Studio': ['FOX']} Review Text: Finally they're back! Seems like I waited years, but it was worth the wait. In Episode 1 the characters seem to have matured, but there is still enough of the quick wit of Ichabod to keep you laughing. I love those moments. Tom Mison is to be commended on his acting skills, and Nichole Beharie is the perfect counterpart. Looking forward to seeing the development of new characters, Betsy Ross, Joe Corbin, and of course the new boss. Could there be a love interest brewing? Glad that Jennie has a bigger part going forward. Can't wait to see what demons invade Sleepy Hollow, and the crossover Episode with Bones. Great start to a new season! Review Title: BOO-YAH ! They're back!!!!!! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Legend of Tarzan Review Date: 2016/12/19 Categories: Drama, Fantasy, Gritty, Intense Product Description: ['Tarzan, having acclimated to life in London, is called back to his former home in the jungle to investigate the activities at a mining encampment.'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Yates'], 'Producers': ['Jerry Weintraub', 'David Barron'], 'Starring': ['Alexander Skarsgård', 'Samuel L. Jackson', 'Margot Robbie']} Review Text: Great movie! Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The 9Th Life Of Louis Drax Review Date: 2017/02/08 Store: Sarah Gadon (Actor), Jamie Dornan (Actor), Alexandre Aja (Director, Producer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Mystery & Thrillers Product Description: ['After surviving eight near-death accidents throughout his unlucky life, Louis Drax [Aiden Longworth] plunges off a steep cliff on his ninth birthday. While police investigate the cause of Louisa near-fatal fall and the whereabouts of his violent father Peter [Aaron Paul], acclaimed neurologist Dr. Allan Pascal [Jamie Dornan] uses unorthodox techniques to try to tap into the boyas unconscious mind and reveal the truth about the events that led to his condition. But as heas drawn deeper and deeper into the mystery of Louisa seeming ability to cheat death, the doctor finds himself falling for Louisa mother, Natalie [Sarah Gadon]. As new clues emerge in the case, a shocking revelation changes the fates of Louis Drax and everyone around him. Based on the novel by Liz Jensen.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '43381868', 'Director': 'Alexandre Aja', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 7, 2017', 'Actors': 'Sarah Gadon, Jamie Dornan, Aaron Paul, Aiden Longworth', 'Producers': 'Tim Bricknell, Max Minghella, Shawn Williamson, Alexandre Aja', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Worse movie I've seen in a long time. It moves at a snail pace. The story is really not interesting. Jamie Dornan's acting was flat at best, and he's one of my favorites. Wish I hadn't sent money on this. Review Title: Wait until it come out on HBO, save your money! Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Fifty Shades Darker Review Date: 2017/02/12 Store: Dakota Johnson (Actor), Jamie Dornan (Actor), James Foley (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ["Jamie Dornan and Dakota Johnson return as Christian Grey and Anastasia Steele in Fifty Shades Darker, the second chapter based on the worldwide bestselling Fifty Shades phenomenon. When a wounded Christian tries to entice a cautious Anastasia back into his life, she demands a new arrangement before she will give him another chance. As the two begin to build trust and find stability, shadowy figures from Christian's past start to circle the couple. Jack Hyde (Eric Johnson) and Elena Lincoln (Kim Basinger) join the cast, determined to destroy the couple's hopes for a future together. This time there are no rules.Bonus Content:", 'A Tease to Fifty Shades Freed', 'A Tease to Fifty Shades Freed', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Writing Darker', 'Writing Darker', 'Dark Reunion', 'Dark Reunion'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Fifty Shades of Grey, Drama, Drama/Love & Romance, DVD Movie, 50 Shades: Darker, Blu-ray Movie, 50 Shades of Gray, Fifty Shades: Darker, 50 Shades of Grey, Fifty Shades of GrayFifty Shades of Grey, Drama, Drama/Love & Romance, DVD Movie, 50 Shades: Darker, Blu-ray Movie, 50 Shades of Gray, Fifty Shades: Darker, 50 Shades of Grey, Fifty Shades of Gray See more', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Dana Brunetti, Dakota Johnson, Kim Basinger, James Foley, Rita Ora, Marcus Viscidi, Niall Leonard, Jamie Dornan, Luke Grimes, Michael De Luca, Eric Johnson, Victor Rasuk, E L James, Marcia Gay HardenDana Brunetti, Dakota Johnson, Kim Basinger, James Foley, Rita Ora, Marcus Viscidi, Niall Leonard, Jamie Dornan, Luke Grimes, Michael De Luca, Eric Johnson, Victor Rasuk, E L James, Marcia Gay Harden See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French Canadian (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 12 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.47 Ounces', 'Director': 'James Foley', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 12 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 9, 2017', 'Actors': 'Dakota Johnson, Jamie Dornan, Eric Johnson, Rita Ora, Luke Grimes', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Michael De Luca, E L James, Dana Brunetti, Marcus Viscidi', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Niall Leonard', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Couldn't wait for this movie to come out, I was not disappointed. I felt it was closer to the book than the first one. Absolutely loved that Jamie and Dakota were less robotic than the first one. Christian came across as more human. There was more humor, Christian smiled more, and you could actually see his struggle with being a gazillionaire dominate, and learning to be in a "regular" relationship.

There are some that didn't care for this movie, but I say, you can't please everyone. Review Title: Loved It!!!!! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/04/30 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Foley'], 'Producers': ['Dana Brunetti', 'Michael De Luca', 'E. L. James', 'Marcus Viscidi'], 'Starring': ['Dakota Johnson', 'Jamie Dornan', 'Eric Johnson']} Review Text: Waste of money and you can't return it from Kindle. There was supposed to be extras like deleted scenes, commentary etc. but there wasn't. I'm disappointed because I already had the rated one and bought this one for the extras. $14.99 down the drain. Review Title: Don't buy! Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/09/19 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Darren Aronofsky'], 'Producers': ['Scott Franklin', 'Darren Aronofsky', 'Mary Parent', 'Arnon Milchan', 'Ari Handel', 'Chris Brigham'], 'Starring': ['Russell Crowe', 'Jennifer Connelly', 'Ray Winstone'], 'Studio': ['Paramount']} Review Text: From the title one would think you will see the story of Noah that you read in the Bible. If however, you read "Lost Books of the Bible," you will find that all things portrayed in the movie are found in the writing of "Enoch." The Watchers, Fallen Angels, Giants etc. can all be found in that one book. Read the lost books first, which is beautifully written, and then watch the movie. I recommend having your Bible beside you as well, as the author gives you references you go go directly to in the Bible. Review Title: Emotional, Informative! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The consumer exhibits a clear enthusiasm for engaging narratives, particularly those enriched with dramatic and fantastical elements, as evidenced by consistently high ratings for series and films focusing on character development and emotional depth. The individual displays a preference for thrilling and intense themes, often gravitating towards fantasy and mystery genres. 

Quality is a significant factor in their purchasing decisions; they express disappointment when content does not meet expectations, especially regarding pacing and character portrayal. This indicates a strong sensitivity to storytelling quality and production value. While they enjoy the excitement of well-rated content, their reactions to perceived lower-quality productions are notably intense, often resulting in negative ratings.

The consumer also demonstrates variable price sensitivity—while willing to pay for compelling content, they express frustration when the value proposition does not align with their expectations, particularly regarding bundled extras or bonus content. Overall, their core preferences highlight a desire for high-quality, well-crafted narratives that provide both entertainment and emotional engagement, coupled with a responsive approach to perceived value in their purchases.

target_interaction.title: Absolutely Mind Blowing!!!!
target_interaction.text:
Without a doubt the best movie of 2020. Christopher Nolan hit this one out of the park. John David Washington and Robert Pattinson are perfect together. Hope they work together again.

The ideal of inversion took 3 viewings to wrap my head around, but when it clicked I couldn't help but cheer. It's a must watch over and over. You'll love it if you "don't try to understand it, just feel it!"
description: Fighting for the survival of the entire world, the Protagonist journeys through a twilight world of international espionage on a mission that will unfold in something beyond real time.
